content.description: This route merges with Gothems Finest, but starts on the right of the arete.
content.protection: About 10 draws to two bolt anchor with no lowering biners.
content.location: On a large ledge at the base of a buttress about 200 yards from the start of the wall.

content.description: This is a well-protected route that starts on small crimps. After getting past a short crimpy section during the first 4 bolts or so, the top of the route offers good holds and fun movement.
content.protection: About 10 draws to a two bolt anchor with no lowering biners.
content.location: The route starts in a small dihedral in front of two ocotillos. It is located on the corner of the Early Wall and Main Wall.

content.description: This route feels bouldery compared to the other ones. Lots of good holds and semi-dynamic movement!
content.protection: About 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. No lowering biners.
content.location: At the end of the Main Wall, right before turning the corner.

content.description: Crimpy section for the first 2 bolts, then smooth sailing to the top boulder problem. The crux is at the second bolt and the top offers a fun sequence to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with no lowering biners.
content.location: To the right of Hide and Seek, below an obvious slab at the top of the route.

content.description: Start at small corner/groove. Move up and left on good holds which lead to a tricky entrance to the crack. Continue up the crack to a roof, move over this and follow better holds to the anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a chain anchor with lowering biners
content.location: Starts around the cliff prow just past the start of the northwest face. 20 feet right of the large juniper tree at a groove which is right of a prominent thin crack above.

content.description: The route starts on a slabby section and heads over a small roof.
content.protection: Shares anchors with Ain't No Half-Steppin'    About 8 bolts to two bolt anchor with no lowering biners.
content.location: One route to the right of Ain't No Half-Steppin'

content.description: Steep moves off the deck lead into a shallow left-facing corner.  Move up the corner on finger locks and stems, turn a small roof, and proceed above past another bulge to the chain anchors.
content.location: On a large ledge at the base of a buttress about 200 yards from the start of the wall.  The route stays just left of the arete.

content.description: A diverse line with a few interesting holds. Starts on a sharp slab and follows a shallow left facing dihedral (crux) up to and around a small roof. Chains are slightly right of the line, making it less than ideal for TR due to rope drag over a rough bulge below the anchors. Rap the route.Dedicated to Kaya & Zia who supervised the extensive cleaning from a safe distance.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain anchors (no lowering biners). Rap the route.
content.location: Approximately halfway down the Main Wall. The start is located directly below a large roof feature ~30 feet above the base of the cliff.

content.description: Climb through a sharp section of high feet, wander right after the 4th bolt on big holds, finish on a smooth crimpy slab. Difficulty is pretty sustained but the upper section is the most technical. Shares anchors with Hide and Seek.Big Daddy Kane - Ain’t No Half-Steppin https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=nqPlF5Mn32M
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchors (no lowering biners).
content.location: Approximately halfway down the Main Wall. The route starts on a small but obvious solitary ledge at the base of the cliff.

content.description: Climb the dihedral past loose blocks and good crack to a very loose blocky belay ledge.
content.location: Thirty feet before the start of Gotham's Finest is a trad dihedral climbed to gain access to place anchors for GF.

content.description:
The original wall at Gotham City. A more shady west-north-west facing cliff up and right of the parking area. The cliff is 80-120' feet tall and maybe 200-300 yards long. There is still plenty of potential on this wall for more routes.

 This wall has a quick 15-minute approach from the end of the road.
